title: 2015 Maruti Ertiga Facelift has been launched in India
text:
2015 Maruti Ertiga Facelift has been launched in India 17th, Oct 2015 11:41 AM View: 9 0 
Maruti Suzuki has finally launched the Ertiga facelift in India with tweaked cosmetics as well as updated engine lineup. The model has been introduced with 6 petrol trims and 5 diesel trims with the starting price of INR 5.99 Lacs and INR 7.55 Lacs respectively. The major change at the mechanical front is that the automaker has introduced SHVS technology for the diesel variant. As we all know that Ciaz had already been rolled out with the hybrid powertrain and is doing quite well, it is evident that something similar is being expected from this new Ertiga. 
Also Read: Maruti Ertiga Facelift 
Talking about the exterior, it has got a considerable amount of modification including three-slat chrome grille, revamped front and rear bumpers, re-designed fog lamps, new tail lamps and a chrome strip running over the license plate. Moving inside, there is a highly modern ambiance equipped with SmartPlay infotainment, TFT touchscreen interface, Bluetooth connectivity, navigation facility and voice command system. For safety, it has front airbags, seatbelt reminder, rear parking sensors with rear parking camera, ABS and EBD. 
Details on: Best MUVs in India 
The petrol model is packed with new generation 1.4 litre K14B VVT motor, while the diesel one gets a 1.3 litre DDiS 200 unit, under the hood. The former delivers 17.5 km/l and the latter is efficient enough to offer a fuel economy of 24.52 km/l, all thanks to the hybrid technology. The SHVS has brought with itself various additional features like Idle Start Stop, Gear Shift Indicator, Brake Energy Regeneration, and Torque Assist.
